get.description: Returns all accounts available on blockchain. By default it returns 25 accounts

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Number of items to skip for the result set

parameters.name: isSmartContract
parameters.description: Filter accounts by whether they are smart contract or not

parameters.name: withOwnerAssets
parameters.description: Return a list accounts with owner assets

parameters.name: withDeployInfo
parameters.description: Include deployedAt and deployTxHash fields in the result

parameters.name: withTxCount
parameters.description: Include txCount field in the result

parameters.name: withScrCount
parameters.description: Include scrCount field in the result

parameters.name: hasAssets
parameters.description: Returns a list of accounts that have assets

parameters.name: addresses
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of addresses to filter by

get.description: Returns total number of accounts available on blockchain

parameters.name: hasAssets
parameters.description: Returns a list of accounts that have assets

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search by account address, assets name

parameters.name: withGuardianInfo

parameters.name: withTxCount
parameters.description: Returns the count of the transactions for a given address

parameters.name: withScrCount
parameters.description: Returns the sc results count for a given address

parameters.name: withTimestamp
parameters.description: Returns the timestamp of the last activity for a given address

parameters.name: withAssets
parameters.description: Returns the assets for a given address

parameters.name: withScResults
parameters.description: Return scResults for transactions. When "withScresults" parameter is applied, complexity estimation is 200

parameters.name: withOperations

parameters.name: withLogs
parameters.description: Return logs for transactions. When "withLogs" parameter is applied, complexity estimation is 200

parameters.name: withUsername
parameters.description: Integrates username in assets for all addresses present in the transactions

parameters.name: senderOrReceiver
parameters.description: One address that current address interacted with

parameters.name: withActionTransferValue
parameters.description: Returns value in USD and EGLD for transferred tokens within the action attribute

parameters.name: withRelayedScresults
parameters.description: If set to true, will include smart contract results that resemble relayed transactions

info.title: Multiversx API
info.description:
The API is built to allow you to create apps or integrations quickly and easily.

This API is organized around REST principles, so if you've interacted with RESTful APIs before, many of the concepts will look familiar.

## Request
* Requests with a message body use JSON. Successful requests will return a `2xx` HTTP status.

## Response

* JSON will be returned for all responses, including errors.

## Parameters

* Some endpoints accept optional parameters which can be passed as query string params. 
* All parameters are documented along each endpoint.

## Complexity

* In order to better optimize the available resources, a complexity evaluation is performed before the execution of every request.

* The maximum complexity available is currently hardcoded at `10000`

* When listing entries, every element in the list adds `1` to the complexity, thus making it possible to retrieve a maximum of `10000` elements in list endpoints.

* If some extra info is requested, such as `withScResults` in the `/transactions` endpoint, the complexity calculation for the list is overridden with the complexity calculation of the requested field. In this situation, `withScResults` will multiply the number of items with `200`, thus limiting the maximum requested size to `50`

* Some fields use the same amount of resources whether one or more of them are requested. In this situation, the fields will be grouped together, regardless whether one or more of the same group are requested. The endpoints `/transactions?size=50&withOperations=true` will produce the same complexity as `/transactions?size=50&withOperations=true&withLogs=true&withScResults=true` since they all belong to the group `details`

## Fields

* In order to fetch only specific fields from the response, the `fields` parameter can be used:
    * `/accounts?fields=address,balance for arrays`
    * `/economics?fields=price,marketCap for object`

## Extract
* In order to extract a scalar value from an object response, the `extract` parameter can be used:
    * `/economics?extract=price`

## Cleanup
* If the value of an attribute is `undefined`, `""` (empty string), `null`, `[ ]` (empty array) the attribute will be omitted.

## Pagination

* Requests that return multiple items will be paginated to 25 items by default. 
* For a different number of items or for the next pages `?from=` and `size=` can be used.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the block where the account was first indexed

shard.description: The shard ID allocated to the account

deployedAt.description: Specific property flag for smart contract

isVerified.description: Specific property flag for smart contract

ownerAddress.description: The address in bech 32 format of owner account

deployedAt.description: Specific property flag for smart contract

txCount.description: The number of transactions performed on this account

scrCount.description: The number of smart contract results of this account

code.description: The source code in hex format

codeHash.description: The hash of the source code

rootHash.description: The hash of the root node

username.description: The username specific for this account

isPayable.description: Specific property flag for smart contract
